resources.string: In this country tradition requires you to write your New Year’s wish on a piece of paper and then set it alight, drop the remains into your champagne glass and drink it before the clock goes past 12.
In Spain, as the midnight strikes, it is customary to quickly eat 12 what (one at each strike of the clock)?
In one of the cities of this country every New Year’s Eve a specially designed ball is \"dropped\" at 11:59 pm EST amidst cheers of millions of spectators.
In this country families get together to bake a special bread for the New Year. They hide a coin in the dough for good luck.
In this country there is a custom to throw away old furniture out from the windows.
In Japan traditional celebrations include (pick 2 answers):
In France adults cook a festive cake with what inside?
In Denmark traditional celebrations include (pick 2 answers):
In this country there is a funny New Year tradition. When people sit around the festive table, the light turns off for 3 minutes.
In this country people drop molten lead into the cold water to see what shape it takes, and predict the future."
Visiting temples to pray for the departed and for good harvest
Dressing up in the costumes of cartoon heroes
Throwing buckets of water out of their windows
Standing on a chair and jumping from it as the clock strikes twelve
Collecting dishes all the year around and throwing them at the front door on the New Year’s Eve
Russia. It is believed that if you manage to do all this while the Chimes are beating, the wish is sure to come true.
12 grapes. They are supposed to bring good luck – one grape for each of the twelve months of the New Year.
USA. This tradition takes place in New York since 1907.
Greece. It is believed that the coin will bring good luck in the new year to the one who finds it.
Italy. It is believed that you do not need to take old things with you to the new year.

Traditional celebrations in Japan include visiting temples to pray for the departed and for good harvest. Temple bells are rung 108 times to scare off the evil. Another ritual with the same purpose is to start laughing as the clock is about to strike midnight.
A bean. The person who takes it out becomes the Bean King, wears the paper crown and can make orders to everyone at that night.

People in Denmark believe that if they stand on a chair and jump from it as the clock strikes twelve to welcome New Year, it would bring them luck. Another tradition is to collect dishes all the year around and throw them at the front door on the New Year’s Eve – the more the broken plates, the more friends one shall have in the New Year.
Bulgaria. These minutes are called \«New Year's minutes for kisses\».
Germany. Each shape symbolizes an aspect of life – love, prosperity etc."
Visiting temples to pray for the departed and for good harvest
Dressing up in the costumes of cartoon heroes
Throwing buckets of water out of their windows
Standing on a chair and jumping from it as the clock strikes twelve
Collecting dishes all the year around and throwing them at the front door on the New Year’s Eve
